text: Well, great!  I'm an interested hand (though without a huge amount of spare cycles) and not so much for feature parity (unless maybe if PGPLOT counts :sweat_smile:) as just for this feature itself.  I'm still wrapping my head around what's part of Plots and what's part of the backends (or maybe what parts of a feature belong in Plots and what other parts belong in the backends).  Any backend that can do `:steppre` and `:steppost` can be coaxed into making a plot that looks like `:stepmid` by massaging the `x` and `y` vectors, though it's probably more efficient to implement it directly.  Can anyone point me in a direction of how to get started on something like this?
